NEW PAGE 36
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
The Development Standards in these Notes provide regulations and conditions must be verified by the
Zoning Administrator in order for a zoning permit to be issued. The purpose of these conditions is to
assure that certain uses which may have complexity, or are potentially incompatible with their
surroundings, meet the specified restrictions. Each use with required development standards shall
comply with the regulations of the district in which it is located and with the requirements specified in
these Notes.
Note 1. Accessory Uses and Structures - In residential districts
a. Accessory structures shall be located in a rear yard not less than five (5) feet from the
rearlot line. The side yard setback shall be the same as for the side yard setback for the
districtwhere located, provided that in no case shall the structure be located within
20 feet of any street right-of-way.
b. Structures except for utility substations or similar structures shall not be located
within any easement.
C. Separate structures must be located a minimum of 10 feet away from the principal
building.
d. Such structures shall cover not more than thirty percent (30%) of the rear yard.
e. Built-in swimming pools are not considered accessory structures.
Note 2. Bed and Breakfast), Air B and B
a. A Bed and Breakfast home (B and B) or Air B and B shall not be located within four
hundred (400) feet of a rooming house, boarding house or another tourist/guest
home.
b. The B and B or Air B and B must be owned by the property owner who also resides
onthe property.
C.
The use shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a
dwelling.
d. Meals served on the premise shall be for guests of the facility.
e. There shall be no exterior advertising except that which is permitted for a home
occupation.
Note 3. Churches
a. A Church or other place of worship may be allowed in a Residential District subject
to the requirements of the district where it is located and provided that the
structure shallhave minimum side and rear yards of fifty (50) feet and a front yard
at least twenty-five (25) feet greater than that required for a single-family
residence within the district, andthat the off-street parking requirement of this
ordinance are met.
b. An outdoor play area for a church in any zoning district shall be enclosed by a
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
Page 34

NEW PAGE 37
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
fence or other protection. The height shall be a minimum of four feet and the
top of the fence shall be free of protrusions. The fencing shall exclude fixed
bodies of water such as ditches, quarries, canals, excavations, and fish ponds.
Gates to the fencedoutdoor play area shall remain securely closed while children
occupy the area.
Note 4. Construction Office Manufactured Home Class A or B, Temporary
A manufactured home type structure (Class A or B) may be temporarily permitted in
the MU and I districts as a construction office on the same lot in which a building is
being erected until the certificate of occupancy has been issued. Such structures shall
comply with the front and side yard requirements of the district and shall be moved off
the lot before or immediately upon issuance of the Certificate of Occupancy for the
building being constructed.
Note 5. Dwelling, manufactured Home, Class A/B, Located on a Lot in RM District
a. Every manufactured home located in the R-M Residential-Manufactured Home
District shall be located on the lot with the long dimension of the manufactured home
parallel tothe street right-of-way on which the lot fronts.
b. In no case shall a manufactured home be located less than 35 feet from the street
right-of-way on which a lot fronts.
Note 6. Dwelling, manufactured home, Class A or B, located on bona fide farm on same
tractof land with an existing residential structure or other principal use
A manufactured home located on a bona fide farm (RA District) may be placed on the
same tract of land as the original residential structure if it meets the following
conditions:
a. the manufactured home shall be occupied only by the children, parents, brothers,
or sisters of the legal owner of the farm;
b.
the manufactured home shall be the full-time, permanent residence of the children,
parents, brothers, or sisters inhabiting the structure;
C.
the manufactured home shall be located at least 500 feet from any adjoining tract
of land or public street;
d. a vegetative screen, natural or planted, shall be maintained on the farm to screen
the home from residential development located on adjoining tracts;
e.
a vegetative screen, natural or planted, shall be maintained on the farm to screen
the home from any public street located within 1,000 feet of the home;
f.
the manufactured home shall not be located closer than thirty (30) feet to an
existing residential structure located on the farm.
g.
If at any time in the future the manufactured home, its location, or its use as a
residence fails to meet any of the criteria listed within this ordinance, the
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
Page 35

NEW PAGE 38
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses - Development Standards
occupation of such home shall cease until all criteria are met.
h. If the manufactured home continues to violation any provision of this ordinance or
remains vacant for a period of six months, the home shall be removed from the
farm. No other manufactured home may be placed on the farm without being
issued a specialuse permit.
i.
If the land upon which the manufactured home is located is subdivided from the
originaltract of land, the subdivided portion upon which the home is located must
meet the definition of a bona fide farm or the manufactured home must be
removed.
Note 7. Home Occupation
A home occupation as defined in this ordinance may be allowed in any Residential
District subject to the following requirements:
a. Before establishing a home occupation, the operator shall obtain a Home
Occupation Permit from the administrator.
b. The use of the dwelling unit for the home occupation shall be clearly incidental and
subordinate to its use for residential purpose by its occupants.
C. The business or service must be located within the dwelling or an associated
accessory building and may not exceed 25 percent of the combined floor area or 500
square feet, ,whichever is less.
d. No more than one (1) person not in residence shall be engaged in such occupation.
e. There shall be no outside storage or change in the outside appearance of the
building or premises, or other visible evidence of the conduct of such home
occupation other than one (1) sign, not exceeding one (1) square foot in area, non-
illuminated, and mounted flat against the wall of the principal building is permitted.
f.
No traffic shall be generated by such home occupation in greater volumes than
would normally be expected in a residential neighborhood, and any need for
parking generated by the conduct of such home occupation shall be met off the
street and other than in any required yard;
g. No equipment or process shall be used in such home occupation which creates
noise, vibration, glare, fumes, or electrical interference detectable to the normal
senses off thelot, if the occupation is conducted in single-family residence, or
outside the dwelling unit if conducted in other than a single-family residence. In the
case of electrical interference, no equipment or process shall be used which creates
visual or audible interference in any radio or television receivers off the premises or
causes fluctuations in line voltage off the premises.
h. There shall be no sales in connection with such home occupation except as made or
crafted on the premises by the occupant, or as permitted in the Table of Permitted
Uses.
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
Page 36

within the dwelling or an associated accessory building and may not exceed 25 percent of the combined floor

Page 36

NEW PAGE 39
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
Note 8. Outdoor storage as accessory use in I district
a. Outdoor storage as an accessory use shall not be located within any required yard.
b. It shall be located in a designated area abutting the associated building(s).
C. Outdoor storage as an accessory use shall not be located within any required buffer
yardas provided in Chapter 8 Landscaping and Buffer Yards.
d. Areas must be fully screened from ground level view from adjacent residential
properties and public streets as provided in Chapter 8 Landscaping and Buffer
Yards.
Note 9. Public Safety Facilities
a. All vehicles and equipment shall be stored indoors (except for police vehicles).
b. All buildings shall be set back at least twenty (20) feet from all property lines.
C. The buildings shall be designed and landscaped in such a way as to blend in withthe
surrounding area.
Note 10. Public Utility Substations, Utility Towers, Pumping Stations, Storage Tanks
Such utility facilities shall be set back at least 20 feet from all property lines and
landscaped in such a way as to blend in with the surrounding area.
Note 11. Warehouses, mini; self-storage (when located in MU district)
a. Storage of hazardous, toxic or explosive materials is prohibited.
b. No outsider storage, including but not limited to boats, RV's, vehicles, storage pods,
is permitted
C.
No business activity other than rental of storage of units may be conducted on the
premises.
d. Perimeter landscaping shall comply with the requirements of Section 8-3. Roadside
Landscaping Requirements, Parking Lots with More Than 10 Spaces.
e. If there are adjacent residential uses, landscaping shall comply with Section 8-5.
Buffering/Screening of Adjoining Incompatible Land Uses.
f. Self-storage facilities adjacent to residential uses shall not operate or allow tenant
access between the hours of 10:00 P.M. and 6:00 A.M.
g.
All buildings associated with self-storage uses shall have exterior vertical surfaces
with at least fifty (50) percent of the area covered by a material or combination of
materials such as decorative brick veneer, stone, stucco, textured block or similar
textured materials with no one material exceeding fifty (50) percent of said area
when directly fronting a street or when within public view from a street.
h. Building walls exceeding fifty (50) feet in length shall be broken or staggered and
shallnot exceed a length of one hundred fifty (150) linear feet regardless of
modulation.
i.
No more than 50 percent of the total site may be occupied by buildings.
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
Page 37
